text: Byron O. House (September 27, 1902 - September 27, 1969) was an American jurist. Born in Saint Louis, Missouri, House lived in Nashville, Illinois. House received his law degree from University of Illinois College of Law and practiced law in Nashville, Illinois. He served as state's attorney and as Illinois Circuit Court judge for Washington County, Illinois. House was a Republican From 1957 until his death in 1969, House served on the Illinois Supreme Court and was chief justice of the court. House died in a hospital in Belleville, Illinois after undergoing emergency abdominal surgery.Illinois Supreme Court-Byron O. House'Byron House, State Court Judge, Dies,' Chicago Tribune, September 28, 1969, section 1, pg. 3 ==Notes== Category:1902 births Category:1969 deaths Category:Lawyers from St. Louis Category:People from Nashville, Illinois Category:University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign alumni Category:Illinois Republicans Category:Illinois state court judges Category:Chief Justices of the Illinois Supreme Court Category:20th-century American judges
title: Byron O. House
